data.author: SharePicks
data.content: Https://startupsmagazine.co.uk/2026-will-be-a-turning-point-for-fintech-heres-what-industry-leaders-expect Features 2026 will be a turning point for fintech, here’s what industry leaders expect January 5, 2026 AI’s role in fintech in 2026 – from payroll systems to real-time pay ecosystems Abigail Vaughan, CEO of Zellis: “In 2026, AI will redefine how people interact with their pay, transforming payroll, benefits, and financial support from static, back-office functions into intelligent, real-time pay ecosystems. Our research revealed that 92% of employees across the UK and Ireland are experiencing financial stress – so it’s no surprise that the demand for more personalised pay experiences is growing, and outdated approaches to pay no longer fit the bill. “AI will drive the next generation of pay, with more than half of employees stating they would value an AI assistant to help with pay and benefits queries thanks to their 24/7 availability and their ability to provide instant answers that traditional payroll systems might struggle to resolve. Next year, AI-enabled pay systems will provide the personalised insights that employees have been waiting for, marking a strategic move towards more resilient and transparent pay operations. “By the end of 2026, AI will be embedded across the pay ecosystem, shaping how people access, understand, and manage their earnings. The result? Clearer pay experiences, higher trust in payroll systems and a more financially literate and confident workforce.” Nadish Lad, Global Head of Product and Strategic Business at Volante Technologies: “For startups building financial infrastructure in 2026, AI-driven payment orchestration will become the competitive differentiator. AI will increasingly coordinate liquidity decisions, exception handling, and anomaly detection as a unified operation. Hybrid and multi-cloud environments make this possible, enabling banks to run on the platform that best meets their needs. “Real-time payments will continue to expand beyond domestic systems. ISO 20022 adoption is accelerating alongside mature domestic instant payment schemes, creating the conditions for high-volume international corridors. As a structured, Cloud-independent data standard, ISO 20022 allows startups to automate sanctions screening, fraud checks, and reconciliation processes that will work consistently across jurisdictions. In 2026, a greater number of startups will be exploring the opportunities beyond their current domestic customer base. “Meanwhile, regulated stablecoins will become practical tools for everyday business operations. Startups can use them to streamline cross-currency capital and enable near-instant business settlements. The opportunity lies in using stablecoins alongside traditional payment rails, adding programmable capabilities that eliminate operational friction in treasury management.

data.author: SharePicks
data.content: Licensing Acquired: RCGH has acquired a Money Lenders Licence in Hong Kong, which enables them to offer digital lending services and expands their potential virtual banking offerings. App Development: The company is developing its RC3.0 App, which will expand its current services to eventually include virtual banking features. Target Roll-out: The company aims to launch its full virtual banking services and the RC3.0 app in early 2026, with a targeted launch for digital lending in late 2025. Geographic Expansion: RCGH intends to expand its virtual banking offerings into the UK and wider Europe in the future. We are close.

data.author: OAPK20
data.content: Could RC365 plug into Ethereum or other chains to offer DeFi-linked yield accounts, crypto-backed lending, or settlement rails. This aligns with the goal of connecting virtual assets to physical consumption. If stablecoin-linked cards (eg Ethereum-based) are a tangible pilot (Brazil) who are RC365 meeting ? But no Ethereum-based products or blockchain infrastructure partnerships are in place yet (no on-chain footprint, no DeFi integration announced). The company seems to be using Web 3.0 as a strategic theme to frame its expansion ambitions, attract partners, and potentially investors. If they can secure credible banking/payment partnerships (eg Brazil) and roll out a pilot, then Web 3.0 could move from buzzword to a genuine differentiator. Where else ? What else? Tokenized Loyalty / Ecosystem - Could there be RC365-branded tokens or reward systems that can be exchanged across merchants, cards, and platforms to mirror Web3’s token-based incentive models?

data.author: SharePicks
data.content: Https://startupsmagazine.co.uk/2026-will-be-a-turning-point-for-fintech-heres-what-industry-leaders-expect Features 2026 will be a turning point for fintech, here’s what industry leaders expect January 5, 2026 AI’s role in fintech in 2026 – from payroll systems to real-time pay ecosystems Abigail Vaughan, CEO of Zellis: “In 2026, AI will redefine how people interact with their pay, transforming payroll, benefits, and financial support from static, back-office functions into intelligent, real-time pay ecosystems. Our research revealed that 92% of employees across the UK and Ireland are experiencing financial stress – so it’s no surprise that the demand for more personalised pay experiences is growing, and outdated approaches to pay no longer fit the bill. “AI will drive the next generation of pay, with more than half of employees stating they would value an AI assistant to help with pay and benefits queries thanks to their 24/7 availability and their ability to provide instant answers that traditional payroll systems might struggle to resolve. Next year, AI-enabled pay systems will provide the personalised insights that employees have been waiting for, marking a strategic move towards more resilient and transparent pay operations. “By the end of 2026, AI will be embedded across the pay ecosystem, shaping how people access, understand, and manage their earnings. The result? Clearer pay experiences, higher trust in payroll systems and a more financially literate and confident workforce.” Nadish Lad, Global Head of Product and Strategic Business at Volante Technologies: “For startups building financial infrastructure in 2026, AI-driven payment orchestration will become the competitive differentiator. AI will increasingly coordinate liquidity decisions, exception handling, and anomaly detection as a unified operation. Hybrid and multi-cloud environments make this possible, enabling banks to run on the platform that best meets their needs. “Real-time payments will continue to expand beyond domestic systems. ISO 20022 adoption is accelerating alongside mature domestic instant payment schemes, creating the conditions for high-volume international corridors. As a structured, Cloud-independent data standard, ISO 20022 allows startups to automate sanctions screening, fraud checks, and reconciliation processes that will work consistently across jurisdictions. In 2026, a greater number of startups will be exploring the opportunities beyond their current domestic customer base. “Meanwhile, regulated stablecoins will become practical tools for everyday business operations. Startups can use them to streamline cross-currency capital and enable near-instant business settlements. The opportunity lies in using stablecoins alongside traditional payment rails, adding programmable capabilities that eliminate operational friction in treasury management.

Next year, AI-enabled pay systems will provide the personalised insights that employees have been waiting for, marking a strategic move towards more resilient and transparent pay operations. “By the end of 2026, AI will be embedded across the pay ecosystem, shaping how people access, understand, and manage their earnings. The result? Clearer pay experiences, higher trust in payroll systems and a more financially literate and confident workforce.” Nadish Lad, Global Head of Product and Strategic Business at Volante Technologies: “For startups building financial infrastructure in 2026, AI-driven payment orchestration will become the competitive differentiator. AI will increasingly coordinate liquidity decisions, exception handling, and anomaly detection as a unified operation. Hybrid and multi-cloud environments make this possible, enabling banks to run on the platform that best meets their needs. “Real-time payments will continue to expand beyond domestic systems. ISO 20022 adoption is accelerating alongside mature domestic instant payment schemes, creating the conditions for high-volume international corridors. As a structured, Cloud-independent data standard, ISO 20022 allows startups to automate sanctions screening, fraud checks, and reconciliation processes that will work consistently across jurisdictions. In 2026, a greater number of startups will be exploring the opportunities beyond their current domestic customer base. “Meanwhile, regulated stablecoins will become practical tools for everyday business operations. Startups can use them to streamline cross-currency capital and enable near-instant business settlements. The opportunity lies in using stablecoins alongside traditional payment rails, adding programmable capabilities that eliminate operational friction in treasury management.

data.author: SharePicks
data.content: Https://startupsmagazine.co.uk/2026-will-be-a-turning-point-for-fintech-heres-what-industry-leaders-expect Features 2026 will be a turning point for fintech, here’s what industry leaders expect January 5, 2026 AI’s role in fintech in 2026 – from payroll systems to real-time pay ecosystems Abigail Vaughan, CEO of Zellis: “In 2026, AI will redefine how people interact with their pay, transforming payroll, benefits, and financial support from static, back-office functions into intelligent, real-time pay ecosystems. Our research revealed that 92% of employees across the UK and Ireland are experiencing financial stress – so it’s no surprise that the demand for more personalised pay experiences is growing, and outdated approaches to pay no longer fit the bill. “AI will drive the next generation of pay, with more than half of employees stating they would value an AI assistant to help with pay and benefits queries thanks to their 24/7 availability and their ability to provide instant answers that traditional payroll systems might struggle to resolve. Next year, AI-enabled pay systems will provide the personalised insights that employees have been waiting for, marking a strategic move towards more resilient and transparent pay operations. “By the end of 2026, AI will be embedded across the pay ecosystem, shaping how people access, understand, and manage their earnings. The result? Clearer pay experiences, higher trust in payroll systems and a more financially literate and confident workforce.” Nadish Lad, Global Head of Product and Strategic Business at Volante Technologies: “For startups building financial infrastructure in 2026, AI-driven payment orchestration will become the competitive differentiator. AI will increasingly coordinate liquidity decisions, exception handling, and anomaly detection as a unified operation. Hybrid and multi-cloud environments make this possible, enabling banks to run on the platform that best meets their needs. “Real-time payments will continue to expand beyond domestic systems. ISO 20022 adoption is accelerating alongside mature domestic instant payment schemes, creating the conditions for high-volume international corridors. As a structured, Cloud-independent data standard, ISO 20022 allows startups to automate sanctions screening, fraud checks, and reconciliation processes that will work consistently across jurisdictions. In 2026, a greater number of startups will be exploring the opportunities beyond their current domestic customer base. “Meanwhile, regulated stablecoins will become practical tools for everyday business operations. Startups can use them to streamline cross-currency capital and enable near-instant business settlements. The opportunity lies in using stablecoins alongside traditional payment rails, adding programmable capabilities that eliminate operational friction in treasury management.

data.content: Licensing Acquired: RCGH has acquired a Money Lenders Licence in Hong Kong, which enables them to offer digital lending services and expands their potential virtual banking offerings. App Development: The company is developing its RC3.0 App, which will expand its current services to eventually include virtual banking features. Target Roll-out: The company aims to launch its full virtual banking services and the RC3.0 app in early 2026, with a targeted launch for digital lending in late 2025. data.author: SharePicks
data.content: Https://startupsmagazine.co.uk/2026-will-be-a-turning-point-for-fintech-heres-what-industry-leaders-expect Features 2026 will be a turning point for fintech, here’s what industry leaders expect January 5, 2026 AI’s role in fintech in 2026 – from payroll systems to real-time pay ecosystems Abigail Vaughan, CEO of Zellis: “In 2026, AI will redefine how people interact with their pay, transforming payroll, benefits, and financial support from static, back-office functions into intelligent, real-time pay ecosystems. Our research revealed that 92% of employees across the UK and Ireland are experiencing financial stress – so it’s no surprise that the demand for more personalised pay experiences is growing, and outdated approaches to pay no longer fit the bill. “AI will drive the next generation of pay, with more than half of employees stating they would value an AI assistant to help with pay and benefits queries thanks to their 24/7 availability and their ability to provide instant answers that traditional payroll systems might struggle to resolve. Next year, AI-enabled pay systems will provide the personalised insights that employees have been waiting for, marking a strategic move towards more resilient and transparent pay operations. “By the end of 2026, AI will be embedded across the pay ecosystem, shaping how people access, understand, and manage their earnings. The result? Clearer pay experiences, higher trust in payroll systems and a more financially literate and confident workforce.” Nadish Lad, Global Head of Product and Strategic Business at Volante Technologies: “For startups building financial infrastructure in 2026, AI-driven payment orchestration will become the competitive differentiator. AI will increasingly coordinate liquidity decisions, exception handling, and anomaly detection as a unified operation. Hybrid and multi-cloud environments make this possible, enabling banks to run on the platform that best meets their needs. “Real-time payments will continue to expand beyond domestic systems. ISO 20022 adoption is accelerating alongside mature domestic instant payment schemes, creating the conditions for high-volume international corridors. As a structured, Cloud-independent data standard, ISO 20022 allows startups to automate sanctions screening, fraud checks, and reconciliation processes that will work consistently across jurisdictions. In 2026, a greater number of startups will be exploring the opportunities beyond their current domestic customer base. “Meanwhile, regulated stablecoins will become practical tools for everyday business operations. Startups can use them to streamline cross-currency capital and enable near-instant business settlements. The opportunity lies in using stablecoins alongside traditional payment rails, adding programmable capabilities that eliminate operational friction in treasury management.

data.author: SharePicks
data.content: Licensing Acquired: RCGH has acquired a Money Lenders Licence in Hong Kong, which enables them to offer digital lending services and expands their potential virtual banking offerings. App Development: The company is developing its RC3.0 App, which will expand its current services to eventually include virtual banking features. Target Roll-out: The company aims to launch its full virtual banking services and the RC3.0 app in early 2026, with a targeted launch for digital lending in late 2025. Geographic Expansion: RCGH intends to expand its virtual banking offerings into the UK and wider Europe in the future. We are close.

data.author: SharePicks
data.content: Https://startupsmagazine.co.uk/2026-will-be-a-turning-point-for-fintech-heres-what-industry-leaders-expect Features 2026 will be a turning point for fintech, here’s what industry leaders expect January 5, 2026 AI’s role in fintech in 2026 – from payroll systems to real-time pay ecosystems Abigail Vaughan, CEO of Zellis: “In 2026, AI will redefine how people interact with their pay, transforming payroll, benefits, and financial support from static, back-office functions into intelligent, real-time pay ecosystems. Our research revealed that 92% of employees across the UK and Ireland are experiencing financial stress – so it’s no surprise that the demand for more personalised pay experiences is growing, and outdated approaches to pay no longer fit the bill. “AI will drive the next generation of pay, with more than half of employees stating they would value an AI assistant to help with pay and benefits queries thanks to their 24/7 availability and their ability to provide instant answers that traditional payroll systems might struggle to resolve. Next year, AI-enabled pay systems will provide the personalised insights that employees have been waiting for, marking a strategic move towards more resilient and transparent pay operations. “By the end of 2026, AI will be embedded across the pay ecosystem, shaping how people access, understand, and manage their earnings. The result? Clearer pay experiences, higher trust in payroll systems and a more financially literate and confident workforce.” Nadish Lad, Global Head of Product and Strategic Business at Volante Technologies: “For startups building financial infrastructure in 2026, AI-driven payment orchestration will become the competitive differentiator. AI will increasingly coordinate liquidity decisions, exception handling, and anomaly detection as a unified operation. Hybrid and multi-cloud environments make this possible, enabling banks to run on the platform that best meets their needs. “Real-time payments will continue to expand beyond domestic systems. ISO 20022 adoption is accelerating alongside mature domestic instant payment schemes, creating the conditions for high-volume international corridors. As a structured, Cloud-independent data standard, ISO 20022 allows startups to automate sanctions screening, fraud checks, and reconciliation processes that will work consistently across jurisdictions. In 2026, a greater number of startups will be exploring the opportunities beyond their current domestic customer base. “Meanwhile, regulated stablecoins will become practical tools for everyday business operations. Startups can use them to streamline cross-currency capital and enable near-instant business settlements. The opportunity lies in using stablecoins alongside traditional payment rails, adding programmable capabilities that eliminate operational friction in treasury management.

company_30s.what_they_do: RCGH Ltd. offers a niche software platform for managing renewable energy asset portfolios.
company_30s.why_they_matter: Its tools aim to reduce operational costs for mid‑size renewable operators, a market projected to grow over 15% annually.
company_30s.current_state: The company is pre‑revenue, still refining its product and looking for early adopters.

rns_narrative: Leadership shuffle: The board appointed a new director on 18th December 2025, signalling a possible strategic pivot.
Financial reporting: Half‑year results released 5th January 2026 show a £1.2m loss, but the filing hints at a cash‑positive trajectory by year‑end.
Governance updates: Multiple filings between July and September 2025 cover AGM notices, financial adviser appointment, and clarification statements—standard corporate housekeeping.

crowd_tape.dominant_theme: No clear community voice; the story is essentially dormant.
crowd_tape.bull_narrative: Bulls would argue that any new leadership and the upcoming AGM could bring fresh capital and a clearer roadmap.
crowd_tape.bear_narrative: Bears point out the lack of revenue, flat search interest, and the fact that all recent filings are routine compliance rather than growth catalysts.
crowd_tape.sentiment_shift: There was a brief spike in chatter when the new director was announced, but sentiment quickly faded back to neutral.

whats_happening_now.attention_check: Google Trends shows an interest level of 0/100 with no momentum, and social media volume is zero. The story has lost oxygen; there’s no organic buzz to fuel a price move.

near_term_catalysts: AGM (Sep 2025): Potential for a new strategic partnership announcement or a capital raise that could validate the business model.
Q2 results (Aug 2026): First revenue print would be a decisive break‑through for the bull case.
expect_next.watch_for: Monitor for any sign of a placement or convertible debt issuance. A sudden drop in director equity or a PDMR filing would be a red flag.
expect_next.timing_regime: APEX indicates an exhausted regime: the price is 80.1% below its peak with no technical support, suggesting any move would be a long‑term play if anything.

buy_vs_sell.bull_case: If the AGM reveals a partnership with a major renewable operator, or if the company secures a £2m convertible placement, the price could rally from its current 0.00p level. A clear revenue stream would also validate the model.
buy_vs_sell.bear_case: Without a tangible revenue announcement, the stock remains a speculative void. The flat search interest and zero social chatter imply that investors are not buying in. The company’s pre‑revenue status and 80% drop from peak make a rebound unlikely in the short term.
buy_vs_sell.risk_reward: High risk, low reward: the upside is capped at a modest price bump, while the downside is essentially a 100% loss of the invested capital.

playbook.if_bullish: Do not enter now; wait for a concrete catalyst such as a revenue announcement or a capital raise. If such a catalyst materialises, consider a small position (2–3% of the portfolio) with a stop at 5p to protect against a continued slide.
playbook.if_watching: Hold off until the AGM or Q2 results. Only consider entering if the company demonstrates a clear path to profitability or a strategic partnership that justifies a price increase.
playbook.if_passing: Stay out. The story is dormant, the technicals are exhausted, and there is no organic traction. Better to allocate capital to setups with clearer catalysts.

ai_insights.bottom_line: Pass for now—no buzz, no catalysts, and a pre‑revenue profile that makes a short‑term upside unlikely. Keep an eye on the AGM and Q2 results; if a revenue surprise or partnership emerges, consider a cautious, small entry.
